intro: Ornithocephalus ciliatus, commonly known as the silky flax, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves with a silvery-white coating. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically blue or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Ornithocephalus ciliatus is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
